channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti, 11th August
item.description:
There are 3 items, all in the same yellow paint and very close together. They are: 1 Under the advertising at the corner 2 the grey box next to it at the corner and 3 the brickwork under the railway arch just slightly further up Croxted Rd. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 87, Norwood Road, Herne Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roof repair rubble dumped, 11th August
item.description:
Roof of 126c has been repaired and the rubbish dumped across the pavement and road. You cannot use pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lanvanor Road, Nunhead, London

item.title: Crossing island has been smashed for months, 11th August
item.description:
I’ve reported this several times and seen near misses regularly. What is happening here ? Why has nothing been done for months. I

item.title: Broken glass looks like tinted car window glass all over pavement, 11th August
item.description:
Broken glass looks like tinted car window glass all over pavement Usual vagrants we’re hanging around there earlier in the day. Dangerous to walk on. Had to walk my dog in the road to get past it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penry Street, Old Kent Road, London

item.title: Thorny Bush Covering Path, 11th August
item.description:
The thorny bush thing that grows each year on this corner has returned with a vengeance. It's covering half the path and the thorns can be quite aggressive. Please can someone cut it down, or rip it out altogether?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 91, Seymour Villas, Anerley, London

item.title: Station Road filthy, 11th August
item.description:
Why does this road only get cleaned when residents report it? We are paying extortionate council tax and this street is never clean

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Penge, London

item.title: Holm Oak Fence Knocked Down, 11th August
item.description:
The small wooden fence around the holm oak, at the Anerley Road end of Betts Park SE20 8TQ, has one section knocked down. Nothing appears broken, it probably needs a sledgehammer to drive the stake back into the ground.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Road, Anerley, London

item.title: Overgrown trees/roots/weeds, 11th August
item.description:
Back of the allotment on clock house road is completely overgrown. The residents should maintain outside their property but the allotment side is not our responsibility. This has never been maintained. Please can this be cut, this is suppose to be an access road but this is impossible to use

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clock House Road, Elmers End, London

item.title: Unwanted waste bins abandoned, 11th August
item.description:
A blue recycling bin and a brown food bin have been abandoned by the litter bin for over a week. They are obstructingbthe pavement and attracting more flytipping. Please remove as they don't belong to any of the neighbours.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dowlas Street, Camberwell, London

item.title: Items dumped, 11th August
item.description:
Hi all, Someone fly tipped in front of Baxter Court, 3 Spurstowe Terrace. Please, can your team kindly remove it. Best regards, Roberto.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Spurstowe Terrace, Hackney, London

item.title: Smashed porcelain ware on public pathway, 11th August
item.description:
Today somebody has dropped white porcelain onto the pavement near the corner of Scotts Lane and Beckenham Grove. It has smashed all over the pavement. With my foot I have tried to push the pieces into one pile and small pieces into the roD gutter. For anyone with sight problems this will be a hazard and for sighted people it is an eyesore

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Grove, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Sycamore, 11th August
item.description:
There is a VERY large Sycamore on Well St Common next to 11 Groombridge Rd.It looks healthy, but I am concerned about its height. It could be potentially dangerous in windy conditions. Could one of your team have a look at it with regard to pruning please?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Groombridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signs restrictions, 11th August

item.title: Chestnut tree, 11th August
item.description:
There is a VERY large Horse Chestnut tree at the entrance to Gerard Place. It looks healthy, but I am concerned about its height. It could be potentially dangerous in windy conditions. Could one of your team have a look at it with regard to pruning please?

item.title: Rubbish opposite 5 Colworth Grove, 11th August
item.description:
